description: Safety-critical V-Model example for a medical device system

inputs.projectRequirements:
Develop software for an Insulin Pump Controller with the following requirements:

1. Insulin Delivery
   - Calculate and deliver basal insulin rates based on patient profile
   - Deliver bolus insulin on demand with dose calculation
   - Maximum single dose safety limit: 25 units
   - Delivery accuracy: Â±5% of programmed dose
   - Delivery rate range: 0.025 to 35 units per hour

2. Glucose Monitoring Integration
   - Receive continuous glucose readings from CGM sensor
   - Update readings every 5 minutes
   - Alert on sensor failure or out-of-range readings
   - Glucose range: 40-400 mg/dL

3. Safety Alarms
   - High glucose alert (configurable threshold)
   - Low glucose alert (configurable threshold)
   - Occlusion detection (blocked infusion line)
   - Low reservoir alert (<20 units remaining)
   - Battery low alert (<20% charge)
   - All critical alarms must have audible and visual indicators
   - Alarm history log maintained

4. User Interface
   - Display current glucose reading
   - Show active insulin (insulin on board)
   - Bolus calculator with carb counting
   - Basal rate programming
   - Settings lockout with PIN protection
   - Large, readable display

5. Data Logging
   - Log all insulin deliveries with timestamps
   - Log glucose readings
   - Log alarms and user actions
   - Data retention: minimum 90 days
   - Export data via USB or wireless

6. Safety Requirements (IEC 62304 Class C)
   - Fail-safe operation: stop delivery on critical errors
   - Watchdog timer monitoring
   - Self-test on startup
   - Redundant safety checks for dose calculations
   - Hardware-software interface validation

7. Non-Functional Requirements
   - Response time to critical alarms: <1 second
   - System uptime: 99.99%
   - Battery life: minimum 7 days
   - Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF): >10,000 hours
   - Compliance: IEC 62304, ISO 14971 (risk management), FDA 21 CFR Part 820

design.modules: 25-35 modules with clear safety criticality levels

traceability.gaps: Must be zero for safety-critical requirements
traceability.compliance: Complete mapping to IEC 62304 and ISO 14971

learningPoints: Fail-safe design and redundant safety checks
notes: This example demonstrates V-Model for highest safety level
Requires complete traceability for regulatory approval
All safety requirements must have multiple test cases
Design review and code inspection required at all phases
